instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPUâ€™s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message:
Hello!
I got an 15" 2011 Hi Res, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which chimes and boots into OSX but there is no video, just a black screen. Also on external I get no video.

What I did:

-PRAM & SMC reset (successful)
-tried another harddisc
-checked LVDS connector, supplies are there but <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> does not enable <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>

-all power rails are there except:

<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL>
only 0,9V
Checked <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> (ISL95870A) and all components around, all ok. Regarding schematic, it should be 0,9V?! When VID0 and VID1 Voltage is 0, Output = 0.9V?!


<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL>
0,9V but then falling down to 0,45V

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
1,15V but then falling down to 0,75V

I have checked current sensing circuit after the big coils on PHASE1,2,3,AVG and connection to <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> (MAX17511). All ok.
That complete "PHASE" circuitry is a bit complicated to understand for me.....

Any ideas or hints how I should proceed or focus on??

THANKS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message: Bad GPU, heat it up to 100C and try again. Was the GPU possibly already fucked with? Edge bonding still present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message:
Ahhh... the plastic/silicin edge bonding is already missing... so it seems someone already tried ti heat it up. :mad:
So you mean, I should replace the whole gpu?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message: So it was fucked with and it will at least need a new GPU. As these are nowhere to be found at the moment this project is a dead end for now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message:
I bought one gpu on ebay, I will let you know.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message: Yeah that will be a reball or a polished up fake or if you bought this 6 months ago it might have been the real deal

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message:
Its a refurbished tested GPU... so you think its a waste of money and time?
Thx

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message: Yes you can toss that in the garbage straight away. Why use someone else's reballed dead chip when you can use your own?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message:
Sorry, I am not fully into that GPU topic... whats wrong with refurbished or reballed GPU?! Dou you think that they just dont work?
I am afraid, that my GPU is completely dead... thats why I dont want to reball mine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message: Someone should correct me if I'm wrong but there were several years that had high failure rates to the point a class action lawsuit forced apples hand. For whatever reason those gpu's were all shit and since no one can buy direct from manufacturer the likelihood of a refurbished chip from those same years not failing is low

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message:
The chip itself is bad, the problem is inside the chip. Heating it up will make it work for a few weeks. 
Why do you think your "refurbished" chip was pulled from a board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message: Yes ok... but still I am wonderung, that my gpu us completely fucked up. I tried already to heat it up a bit to 160degrees... but still no change or image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Chimes but no Video only blackscreen
threads.message: I have no idea, only way to find out is to replace it. But replacing it with another zombie GPU is just a waste of time. Get a REAL NEW chip, they are out there, but very hard to find.
